captions.text:
Our new brake
pads are really cool.

You're not even
gonna believe it.

Like, umm, let's say you're
drivin' along the road
with your family

And you're drivin' along.
La, de, da, whoo.

Then, all of a sudden,
there's a truck tire
in the middle of the road

[imitating brakes screeching]
and you hit the brakes.

Now, let's see what
happens when you're

Driving with
the "other guy's" brake pads.

You're drivin' along,
you're drivin' along,

"I gotta go to the bathroom,
daddy."
No, I can't feel my legs!"

All because you want to save
a couple of extra pennies.

title: Tommy Boy (2/10) Movie CLIP - Desktop Demo (1995) HD

comments.author: BlinkinFirefly

comments.text:
+orbison Not only was he due to play Fatty Arbuckle, but let's not forget 
either that he was also attached to play the titular role of Atuk, the 
infamous cursed Hollywood script that killed every overweight comedian who 
ever read it from the 80's and 90's.  John Belushi, Sam Kinison, John 
Candy.  Very creepy coincidence.
comments.author: Hambone Jones

comments.text:
Awww that's so sad. =( I didn't know he had a sister. Is the biography on 
YouTube?
comments.author: BlinkinFirefly

comments.text:
By coincidence, I just saw the A&E Biography on Farley, and it discusses 
Tommy Boy, and Farley's sister said she teared up at the ending when Tommy 
talks to his dad in Heaven ("I still love you, and I sure miss you a a 
lot") and then they say that his father (a tough Irishman) began to tear up 
at that moment as well. The most interesting thing I learned about Farley 
in that Bio was that had he lived, David Mamet would have cast him as Fatty 
Arbuckle.

comments.author: Javier Lopez

comments.text:
I'm doing my student teaching right now at an elementary school and we 
always have 30 minutes of recess every afternoon. My first week a group of 
kids came running to me and said, "Johnny" has fallen. I proceeded to go 
over where he had fallen off the swing and I said" In comes the meat wagon 
weo weo weo" and the students absolutely loved it. 4 weeks later, and every 
time some one falls down, a lot of them will say the meatwagon line and 
make the "weo" sound. God, I miss Farley. He was the best.
